quest.name: Practical Needs
journal: Redolent Rose has a special task for you.
The guildmaster wishes to reward a regular customer's loyalty with his choice of bespoke garments. Meet with Wawarukka on Onyx Lane and offer your services.

Wawarukka is surprised by your generous offer, as he does not consider himself a regular customer, his many purchases having been made on behalf of the Miners' Guild. Loath to look a gift chocobo in the mouth, however, he asks you to craft a cotton scarf and a pair of cotton shepherd's slops for him. Prepare the requested garments and deliver them to Redolent Rose, ready for a final fitting.

Although Redolent Rose offers to provide Wawarukka with even finer garments, the miner is more than satisfied with the scarf and slops you have made. The guildmaster can only defer to the customer's decision.

※The next weaver quest will be available from Redolent Rose upon reaching level 20.
objectives: Deliver a cotton scarf and a pair of cotton shepherd's slops to Redolent Rose.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Good of you to come, Forename. I happen to have work for you.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: It is a commission of sorts for one of our regular customers─a gentleman named Wawarukka.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: To show our appreciation for his continued patronage, I would present him with his choice of bespoke garments.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Seek him out on Onyx Lane and offer your services. Oh, and remember, Forename─you are representing me, so acquit yourself accordingly.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Aye, I'm Wawarukka. Who's askin'?

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Ah, hells...Big Rose don't need to go troublin' hisself on my account. All them gloves an' scarves were for the guild, not me.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: I'm somethin' of a quartermaster 'round here, see, an' the lads go through gear faster'n a coblyn chewin' on a chunk of mythril.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: But if the big man insists, it'd be rude not to accept.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Now then, I reckon I could do with a new, uh...cotton scarf. Aye, an' a pair of cotton shepherd's slops an' all. Ones I've got are on their last legs, see─been meanin' to get 'round to replacin' 'em.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: I 'spect you'll be wantin' me to come to the guild for a fittin', will you? See you there, then!

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Don't trouble yourself too much, eh? Long as the scarf don't chafe and the slops don't sag, I'll be more than happy.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: A cotton scarf and a pair of cotton shepherd's slops? That's all? Well...let's not keep the customer waiting.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: All right then, Forename.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Your garments are ready, good sir. Allow me to help you into them.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Cor! These are nice! Bloody nice! I've never had such fine garments before!

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: You're a weaver an' half, you are, Forename! Big Rose always did know how to train 'em.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: You are too kind, sir.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Pardon me for saying so, sir, but I must confess that I had rather...finer raiments in mind when I extended you this invitation. Should you desire such, I would be honored to make them for you myself.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah! Thanks, Big Rose, but no thanks. I can't see meself in frilly wotsits. A mine's where I belong, not some fancy ball.

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: You need a lady on your arm to go to them things! Hah! That'll be the day, eh!?

dialogue.name: WAWARUKKA
dialogue.text: Anyroad, I'd best get on, but knowin' how fast the lads go through gloves, I daresay I'll be back before too long. Thanks again for the duds!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: <sigh> You can lead a chocobo to water... Good work, Forename. Carry on.
